newsitem.title: UK: Bank of England governor sees case for future rate rise.
newsitem.headline: Bank of England governor sees case for future rate rise.

text.p: Bank of England governor Eddie George said October's British interest rate rise may not be enough to bring inflation down to the government's target, minutes from a October 30 monetary meeting showed.
Chancellor of the Exchequer (finance minister) Kenneth Clarke and George agreed to push up interest rates by a quarter percentage point to six percent at the meeting.

"That might well not be enough to moderate the upswing sufficiently to restore a better-than-evens chance of achieving the inflation target over the next two years," the minutes quoted George as saying.
But George said the October rate rise would reduce the size and speed of any future rate rises that might eventually be necessary to meet the government's 2.5 percent target for underlying inflation.
The Chancellor said there was no longer a risk of below-trend economic growth.
